title: Protective Motivation Theory-Based Educational Design to Strengthen Adolescents' Personal Information Management Behavior

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic personal information protection concepts and online data breach cases
context.additional_context: Provides a personalized data management simulation learning environment integrated with math domain expertise. Utilizes smartphone-based VR/simulation tools. Most learners are job seekers with extensive SNS and online activity experience.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze personal information leakage risk scenarios by applying the Protection Motivation Theory (PMT) elements of threat appraisal and coping appraisal.
Learners can execute proactive and reactive personal information protection strategies in a simulated environment with over 80% accuracy.
Learners can understand the interaction between self-efficacy and vulnerability awareness and establish realistic personal information protection plans based on this understanding.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
